intro: Crepis biennis var. ceretana, commonly known as the common mouse-ear chickweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage with small, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows. Its botanical features make it adaptable to a variety of environmental conditions.
